data.title: Australian Province of the Society of Jesus (Jesuits)
data.meta_description: Australian Province of the Society of Jesus (Jesuits) | 552 followers on LinkedIn. The Society of Jesus is also generally referred to as ‘the Jesuits’. Founded by Saint Ignatius Loyola more than 450 years ago, the Society is an international Catholic religious male order of priests, brothers and others in formation for these roles. The Australian Province of the Society of Jesus had its beginnings with the arrival of the first Jesuits in Australia in 1848.
data.text:
🚶♀️🚶♂️ Jesuit Mission Australia's ongoing One Foot Raised campaign has already raised over $54,000 for Myanmar! In the week coinciding with the feast day of St Ignatius of Loyola (31st July), Australian Catholics of all ages (VIC, NSW and SA) participated to raise awareness, prayers and funds for the people of Myanmar. A number of Australian Jesuit schools, parishes and ministries participated, including Saint Ignatius' College Riverview (NSW), Our Lady of the Way Parish North Sydney (NSW), The Cardoner Network (NSW), Saint Ignatius College Geelong (VIC), JISA Sevenhill and Riverton Parishes (SA). Additionally, Xavier College, Kew (VIC) will undertake One Foot Raised later in the year. It's not too late to make a meaningful difference and support this great cause. Jesuit Mission is hoping to raise $75,000 this year! Find out more: 👉 www.onefootraised.org.au Photos courtesy of Jesuit Mission Australia PHOTO 1: After a shared prayer for Myanmar, the Jesuit Mission Sydney team walked 10km, including across Sydney’s iconic Harbour Bridge. PHOTO 2: A great turn out across all ages from Our Lady of the Way Parish, North Sydney, walking 2-4km in solidarity. #jesuits #societyofjesus #jesuit

🚲 As a cyclist, Fr Iain Radvan SJ is equally at home on the bitumen or exploring an off-road route on his 27-gear bike that is fitted with wide tyres. In the summer of 2022, he rode about 700 kms interstate, from Warrnambool to Adelaide. He says: “When things are going well, the legs go round, crossing the countryside and finding the space; that is God’s joy.” Find out more: 👉 https://lnkd.in/gegqMJhw Photo courtesy of Fr Iain Radvan SJ #jesuits #societyofjesus #jesuit

🛑⚠️ Safeguarding delegates from the provinces and regions in the Jesuit Conference Asia Pacific (JCAP) met in Bali, Indonesia last month. In this video, watch how the delegates delved into rich discussions, shared knowledge and committed to maintaining safeguarding in our ministries and apostolates. The meeting was hosted by Simon Davies, the Australian Province’s Director of Professional Standards. Find out more: 👉 https://lnkd.in/gX7-Rqex Video by JCAP. #jesuits #societyofjesus #jesuit

🌏🇮🇩 Participants from around the world recently gathered in Yogyakarta to chart the global future of Jesuit education. Barbara Watkins (pictured right), Executive Director, Jesuit Education Australasia, cites the importance of the depth of reflection and discussion. “This, coupled with the connections we made with the very rich and diverse Jesuit community around the world was truly exceptional, as was the passion with which those gathered entered into their roles and the calling that we shared.“ Find out more: 👉 https://lnkd.in/gzMgsefJ Photo courtesy of Barbara Watkins. #jesuits #societyofjesus #jesuit

🍇👣 Sevenhill Cellars, established in 1851, has received a South Australian tourism grant to support the digitalisation of the Heritage Walking Trail at its historic property. This will further enrich the visitor experience at one of the state's most historically significant sites. The project is scheduled for completion by January 2025. Find out more: 👉 https://lnkd.in/gb6hyqFr Photo courtesy of Sevenhill Cellars. #jesuits #societyofjesus #jesuit
